page.title: 09HIGHAM-ON-THE-HILL
page.content: At the highest point in the block is the village of{Higham-on-the-Hill with a population of 498 adults (including 140 senior citizens) and 127 children.There is a cross section of professional,clerical,skilled labour and labouring classes. {The Parish Council}(Chairman and five members)conduct the running of the village.A local resident is a member of the Leics.County Council. A mix of mod.houses and modernised cottages total 231(76 houses being administered by the Borough Council). Private houses are well kept-some cottages are 100-300 yrs.old.There are two housing developments for the elderly-bungalows and flats.Lack of sewage facilities prevents further large developments.{Higham Hall(1900) stands among lawns and trees and is surrounded by a high red brick wall.
